page.title: 05RECREATION
page.content: BEFORE THE DAYS OF RADIO AND RECORDS, MANY VILLAGES HAD THEIR OWN SPECIAL FORMS OF MUSIC AND DANCING. SOME OF THESE IN ENGLAND AND THE BORDER AREAS OF WALES WERE KNOWN AS MORRIS DANCING. NOWADAYS NEW MORRIS GROUPS, KNOWN AS SIDES, HAVE BEEN FORMED TO REVIVE THE OLD DANCES. MORRIS MYNYDD DDU WAS FORMED IN APRIL 1980 AND INCLUDED THREE PEOPLE FROM VELINDRE. MEMBERS PRACTICE IN VELINDRE IN THE WINTER. IN THE SUMMER, AT WEEKENDS AND ON BANK HOLIDAYS, THEY TRAVEL AROUND POWYS AND SOMETIMES FURTHER AFIELD TO GIVE DANCE DISPLAYS AT FETES, IN TOWN AND VILLAGE CENTRES AND AT PUBS. THE DANCES THEY PERFORM INCLUDE COTSWOLD, NORTHWEST, CLOG, LICHFIELD BORDER, STOVE AND ROPPER (SWORD) DANCES. SOMETIMES THEY MORRIS SIDE ORGANISE CEILIDHS (FOLK DANCES).
